values.comments: This course covers the influence of money in politics, the cause of suicide terrorism, and police discriminiation against racial minorities. The course tries to explain political questions taken from international relations, American politics, comparative politics, and public policy. Students will learn how to construct research designs to test hypotheses and analyze the political world.   Students unanimously raved about this course. Several called it the, “best” or, “most important” class they had taken at Penn. One student claimed that it, “teaches undergrads how to think, not just what to think,” while another felt it was, “an essential class for anyone looking to do social science research.”  Reviews of Professor Malhotra were exclusively positive. Students called him “brilliant,” “fascinating,” and, “always available.”  Students commented that “the reading load is extremely light” and “participation is constant.” Several recommended this class to anyone interested in social sciences. The course is open to both freshmen and upperclassmen.
